value.message:
Fix SignalR race condition, implement real-time updates, and enhance results display

- Added final fix for SignalR script loading race condition to ensure proper initialization.
- Updated CrawlerController to handle asynchronous crawling and return 202 Accepted response.
- Implemented real-time updates via SignalR for crawl progress and completion messages.
- Enhanced JavaScript to display results upon crawl completion using SignalR.
- Resolved Visual Studio npm build errors by making npm build non-blocking and adding verification for output.
- Fixed permission issues during Vite build in Visual Studio by improving clean script with retry logic.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Update docs for v2.2.0: package split, quality, .NET 10

Comprehensive documentation refresh for v2.2.0:
- Updated all pages to v2.2.0, .NET 8/9/10 support, and 237+ tests (711 runs)
- Added clear package split (Base & Crawler), install and DI guidance
- Documented new quality features: Source Link, .snupkg, AOT/trimming, package validation, zero-warning builds
- Expanded version history and migration guidance for v1.x users
- Updated footers, meta tags, and navigation for consistency and SEO
- Added docs-update-summary.md with change rationale and checklist
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Add release execution summary for v2.2.0

Includes detailed markdown documenting the v2.2.0 release process: actions taken, workflow steps, package details, monitoring instructions, verification checklist, rollback plan, post-release tasks, timeline, and highlights of new features. This provides a transparent and traceable record of the release.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
chore: bump version to 2.2.0 - Quality and Tooling release

Added Source Link debugging, symbol packages, trimming/AOT readiness, package validation, zero-warning builds. Demo app migrated to Vite/NPM. All 237 tests passing. Zero breaking changes.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Enhance build pipeline: lint, format, docs, zero warnings

Upgraded npm build process for WebSpark.HttpClientUtility.Web:
- Added ESLint, Stylelint, Prettier with strict configs
- New scripts for clean, lint, format, and zero-warning builds
- Updated source files to pass all lint/format checks
- Created config files for linting and formatting
- Added detailed build and quick reference documentation
- Build now fails on any lint warnings for maximum code quality
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Add explicit Microsoft.NET.ILLink.Tasks 10.0.1 to all projects

Explicitly reference Microsoft.NET.ILLink.Tasks version 10.0.1
in all .csproj files to ensure consistent linker/trimmer
behavior across the solution. This overrides the SDK-provided
version and helps address potential build or compatibility
issues related to ILLink.Tasks.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Improve NuGet quality, trimming/AOT readiness, docs

- Enable Source Link, symbol packages, and package validation for both base and crawler projects
- Add trimming and AOT analyzers; annotate all reflection-based APIs with RequiresUnreferencedCode/RequiresDynamicCode
- Add global suppressions for test and demo projects; disable analyzers where not needed
- Update package icons, metadata, and documentation to reflect new quality features
- Add markdown docs for build status, annotation patterns, and package improvements
- Solution is now trimming-aware and ready for v2.2.0 release, with only minor annotation fixes remaining
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Migrate to Vite/NPM pipeline for all client-side assets

- Replace LibMan/CDN/lib folder with NPM-managed Vite build for JS/CSS
- Add package.json, package-lock.json, and .gitignore for node_modules and Vite output
- Configure Vite for bundling, minification, hashed filenames, and manifest
- Add main.js, site.js, and site.css as modern entrypoints (Bootstrap, Icons, custom code)
- Implement ViteAssetTagHelper for manifest-based asset injection in Razor
- Update _Layout.cshtml to use <vite-style> and <vite-script>, remove all lib/CDN refs, and show warning if Vite assets missing
- Enhance .csproj to auto-run npm install/build and clean Vite artifacts
- Add detailed docs: README, BUILD-PIPELINE, MIGRATION-SUMMARY, VERIFICATION-CHECKLIST
- Register TagHelper in _ViewImports.cshtml
- App now uses only NPM-built, tree-shaken, minified, cache-busted assets
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Update Microsoft.Extensions.* packages to 10.0.1

Upgraded Microsoft.Extensions.Caching.Memory to 10.0.1 in all projects. Also updated Microsoft.Extensions.Caching.Abstractions and Microsoft.Extensions.Http to 10.0.1 in WebSpark.HttpClientUtility.csproj. No other changes made.

value.message:
Improve GitHub Actions test reporting

Enhanced the `publish-nuget.yml` workflow by using auto-generated TRX file names to prevent overwriting and organizing test results into separate directories for each .NET framework version. Added detailed debugging output and a verification step to ensure TRX files exist before reporting. Configured the test reporter to not block the workflow if issues arise.

Updated `github-actions-fix.md` to document these changes, explaining the root causes and solutions, and providing a troubleshooting guide.

Added `quick-fix-summary.md` to offer a concise overview of the fixes, highlighting key changes and expected outcomes in GitHub Actions logs.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Fix GitHub Actions SDK and test reporting issues

Updated `publish-nuget.yml` to improve the GitHub Actions workflow by addressing SDK version mismatches and test result reporting issues. Changed `global.json` rollForward policy to `latestFeature` to allow preview/RC .NET 10 versions. Consolidated test results into a single directory with explicit TRX file names, and ensured test reporting runs regardless of build success. Added `github-actions-fix.md` for detailed documentation. Updated Visual Studio solution file version.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message: fix: resolve test reporter file discovery issue and consolidate test results
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Fix GitHub Actions test reporting issue

Updated `publish-nuget.yml` by removing steps for .NET SDK setup, dependency restoration, solution building, and test execution across multiple .NET versions. Added `github-actions-test-reporter-fix.md` to document the resolution of test result discovery issues caused by directory structure mismatches and path pattern problems. Consolidated test results into a single directory, simplified path patterns, and added a debug step to ensure correct test result reporting. Maintained compatibility with existing artifact uploads and code coverage generation.

value.message:
docs(release): add complete v2.0.0 release notes

Add a comprehensive release document (copilot/session-2025-11-05/release-v2.0.0-complete.md) summarizing the v2.0.0 release:
- Documents merge of 003-split-nuget-packages and creation of v2.0.0 tag
- Notes atomic CI/CD publish of two packages (base + crawler) to NuGet with package hashes
- Includes build/test results (build success, 474 tests passing), code quality and signing details
- Describes package-split migration steps, sitemap/RSS discovery feature, demo app, and key bug fixes
- Lists release metrics, lessons learned, next steps and repository/remote state
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Merge feature: Split NuGet packages into base and crawler extension (v2.0.0)

Completed implementation of 003-split-nuget-packages feature:
- Split monolithic package into WebSpark.HttpClientUtility (base) and WebSpark.HttpClientUtility.Crawler (extension)
- Base package size reduced by 63% (164.52 KB vs ~450 KB in v1.5.1)
- Dependencies reduced from 13 to 10 in base package
- All 474 tests passing (420 base + 54 crawler)
- Added interactive demo UI with real-time SignalR progress updates
- Implemented sitemap/RSS discovery feature for JavaScript SPA sites
- Fixed StreamingHelper JSON deserialization for string responses
- Improved crawler defaults (MaxDepth: 3, MaxPages: 100)

Breaking Changes:
- Users of crawler features must now install WebSpark.HttpClientUtility.Crawler package
- Users must call both AddHttpClientUtility() and AddHttpClientCrawler() in DI
- Non-crawler users experience zero breaking changes

See CHANGELOG.md for full details.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
feat(crawler,web): add sitemap/RSS discovery, demo MVC UI, and streaming string handling

- Add CrawlerOptions.DiscoverFromSitemapAndRss (default: true)
- Implement SiteCrawler.DiscoverUrlsFromSitemapAndRssAsync() and ExtractUrlsFromXml() to fetch sitemap.xml, rss.xml, feed.xml and atom.xml and enqueue discovered same-domain URLs
- Update crawl notifications to send per-page progress (Crawled/Queue/Found)
- Switch CrawlerController from API (ControllerBase) to MVC (Controller); add Index view action, change Crawl endpoint to return a serializable DTO and improved error handling; add helper to extract page titles
- Add interactive Razor UI at Views/Crawler/Index.cshtml with SignalR client for real-time progress, crawler options (including sitemap/RSS toggle), and results table
- Fix StreamingHelper to return raw string content when T == string (avoid JSON deserialization for HTML)
- UI/layout fixes: update _Layout.cshtml menu/version badges, remove absolute footer positioning and convert layout to flexbox (.container flex:1) to prevent overlap
- Add development logging settings for crawler/streaming in appsettings.Development.json
- Update specs/plan/tasks documentation to reflect sitemap/RSS discovery and demo enhancements
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
chore(crawler): add README-Crawler to package and finalize package-split docs

- WebSpark.HttpClientUtility.Crawler.csproj: enable PackageReadmeFile, include README-Crawler.md in package, clarify PackageIcon comment
- Add comprehensive WebSpark.HttpClientUtility.Crawler/README-Crawler.md (quickstart, examples, options, requirements, migration)
- Mark split implementation complete across specs: update spec.md, plan.md, tasks.md (status summaries, task completion)
- Add implementation artifacts and reports: copilot session README, implementation-status-report.md, and IMPLEMENTATION-COMPLETE.md

Primarily documentation and package metadata updates to finalize the NuGet package split and prepare for release.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
feat(crawler): extract crawler into separate NuGet package and update packaging, CI, docs, and tests

- Add new WebSpark.HttpClientUtility.Crawler project with crawler surface:
  SiteCrawler, SimpleSiteCrawler, ISiteCrawler, CrawlResult, CrawlException,
  RobotsTxtParser, CrawlHub, SiteCrawlerHelpers, Lock, CrawlerOptions,
  CrawlerPerformanceTracker and related types.
- Implement AddHttpClientCrawler DI extension and ServiceCollection wiring
  (SignalR, HttpClientFactory, default IConfiguration/IStringConverter, IHttpRequestResultService factory).
- Move crawler demo controller and web app integrations:
  register crawler package (AddHttpClientCrawler), map CrawlHub, update Program.cs.
- Change CurlCommandSaver to use JSON Lines (.jsonl) instead of CSV:
  remove CsvHelper usage, update options and file rotation/logging paths.
- Update packaging and project metadata:
  - WebSpark.HttpClientUtility (base) trimmed description, removed crawler deps (CsvHelper, HtmlAgilityPack, Markdig),
    disabled package validation for v2.0.0, note versioning now lockstep.
  - WebSpark.HttpClientUtility.Crawler csproj contains crawler-specific metadata and release notes.
- Update CI workflow (.github/workflows/publish-nuget.yml) to pack both packages,
  upload combined artifact and publish both packages atomically on version tags.
- Documentation and release notes:
  - README and CHANGELOG updated with v2.0.0 two-package split, migration steps and features.
- Tests and test projects:
  - Adjust test project NoWarn settings, add OpenTelemetry in test csproj,
  - Move and rework crawler tests into crawler test project, add global using for MSTest,
  - Remove outdated/duplicated test files and update assertions to JSONL expectations.
- Misc: various cleanup, small API/option renames (CsvFileName -> FileName) and improved defaults.

This implements the v2.0 package split: lightweight base package (core HTTP features) + dedicated crawler extension (web crawling features) with coordinated build/publish and migration guidance.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
feat: split Crawler into its own NuGet package and update build/solution

- Extract crawler functionality into a new WebSpark.HttpClientUtility.Crawler package
  (add Crawler csproj, CrawlerOptions, ServiceCollectionExtensions and a Crawler.Test project).
- Remove crawler implementation files from the main library (moved to the new package).
- Update solution to include WebSpark.HttpClientUtility.Crawler and its test project.
- Centralize and enrich build/package metadata in Directory.Build.props:
  versioning, multi-targeting, license, project URL, strong-name signing, SourceLink,
  and NuGet package generation settings (symbols/docs).
- Adjust WebSpark.HttpClientUtility.csproj for the split:
  remove ASP.NET Core framework reference and crawler-specific deps, swap caching package,
  remove SourceLink/in-memory OTEL exporter from the published package.
- Remove in-memory OpenTelemetry exporter from library OpenTelemetry setup (kept for test projects).

value.message:
docs(specify): strengthen NuGet CI/CD policy in constitution and add daily session summary

Clarify that ALL NuGet publications must go through GitHub Actions (explicitly forbid manual uploads, `dotnet nuget push`, bypassing CI/CD, and combining version bumps with feature work) and expand rationale that the workflow is the single source of truth. Also add copilot session daily-summary (2025-11-02) documenting the static docs site, zero-warning effort, tests, and repository cleanup.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
docs: enforce GitHub Actions CI/CD requirement for NuGet publishing

- Clarify that ALL NuGet package publications MUST go through GitHub Actions
- Prohibit manual publishing via NuGet.org upload or dotnet nuget push
- Emphasize CI/CD pipeline as single source of truth for releases
- Ensures consistent builds, proper testing, and audit trails

value.message:
feat: Add static documentation site with Eleventy (#1)

* initial spec/plan/task

* chore(docs): add initial Eleventy docs site, homepage, assets, and npm lock

- Add package.json to define the docs site project:
  - project name: webspark-httpclientutility-docs v1.4.0
  - Node engines: >=20, npm >=10
  - scripts: clean, dev, build, build:prod, test:links, test:html, validate
  - dependencies: node-fetch
  - devDependencies: @11ty/eleventy, htmlhint, hyperlink, markdown-it, markdown-it-anchor, rimraf

- Add package-lock.json (full lockfile) to lock all dependencies for reproducible builds.

- Add documentation homepage (src/pages/index.md):
  - Eleventy markdown template using layouts/base.njk with frontmatter (title, description, permalink)
  - Hero, features, quick C# example, architecture, telemetry, targets, license and CTAs
  - Designed as the landing page for WebSpark.HttpClientUtility docs

- Add Prism syntax-highlighting placeholders:
  - src/assets/css/prism-tomorrow.css — Tomorrow Night theme fallback styles
  - src/assets/js/prism.min.js — placeholder script with instructions to replace with a custom Prism build
  - Note: these are placeholders; replace with the downloaded/custom Prism build when ready

- Add other site assets:
  - src/assets/images/favicon.ico — placeholder favicon file
  - src/robots.txt — robots policy allowing all and pointing to sitemap

Notes:
- This commit bootstraps the static documentation site and locks dependencies. Further work:
  - Add real Prism build, site styles, and templates
  - Integrate CI publishing (if desired) and update sitemap URL as needed

* Implement full static docs site (Eleventy) with environment-aware build, Prism.js, NuGet integration, and generated /docs output

Summary:
- Finish implementation and deployment of the static documentation site for WebSpark.HttpClientUtility.
- Add environment-aware Eleventy configuration (dev vs production) including dynamic pathPrefix, conditional passthrough copy, watch ignores to avoid infinite rebuilds, and helpful template filters.
- Integrate real Prism.js syntax highlighting (C#, JS, JSON, PowerShell, Bash, markup) with a bundler script and theme.
- Add NuGet data fetch + cache fallback and update navigation/templates to use Eleventy url filter so production subdirectory works.
- Produce final generated site in /docs with all pages (home, features, getting-started, examples, api-reference, about).
- Update specs and tasks docs with Implementation Summary and detailed Eleventy configuration learnings / troubleshooting guidance.

Key changes (files & highlights):
- src/.eleventy.js
  - Make pathPrefix environment-aware (ELEVENTY_ENV=production → "/WebSpark.HttpClientUtility/"; otherwise "/")
  - Add eleventyConfig.watchIgnores.add("./_data/nuget-cache.json") to prevent infinite rebuild loop
  - Conditional addPassthroughCopy for assets and favicon depending on environment
  - Add helpful template filters (formatNumber, formatDate, dateISO) and dev server options

- src/package.json & src/package-lock.json
  - Add prismjs and cross-env dependency entries
  - Update scripts:
    - "dev": eleventy --serve
    - "build": clean + copy:prism + cross-env ELEVENTY_ENV=production eleventy
    - "copy:prism": node scripts/copy-prism.js
  - Add validation/test scripts (htmlhint, hyperlink) and engine hints

- src/scripts/copy-prism.js
  - New script that bundles prism core + selected language components into assets/js/prism.min.js and copies prism-tomorrow.css into assets/css/

- src/assets/js/prism.min.js & src/assets/css/prism-tomorrow.css
  - Add real Prism.js bundle (core + language components) and Tomorrow theme (replaced placeholders)

- src/_data/navigation.json
  - Replace hardcoded /WebSpark.HttpClientUtility/... URLs with relative paths ("/", "/features/", etc.)

- src/_data/nuget-cache.json
  - Update cachedAt timestamp (cache file present in repo; now ignored by watcher)

- src/_includes/layouts/base.njk, header.njk, footer.njk, pages (index.md, features.md, getting-started.md, api-reference.md, examples.md, about.md)
  - Replace hardcoded paths with url filter usages ({{ '/assets/... ' | url }}), update front-matter permalinks to relative
  - Footer: make author name a clickable link to https://markhazleton.com
  - Header: use url filter for home link and navigation items; nav items use item.url | url

- src/assets/css/main.css
  - Add footer link styles and small polish

- src/pages/* (Markdown) and src/_includes/*
  - Add content pages (about, api-reference, features, getting-started, examples, home) with proper front matter and content; ensure permalinks are relative

- src/_data and data fetcher (nuget.js referenced in spec; cache handling described)
  - NuGet API integration implemented with cache fallback pattern (documented in spec and tasks)

- specs/*
  - specs/001-static-docs-site/plan.md: extensive "Implementation Completed" summary, Implementation Learnings, env patterns, configuration, testing & troubleshooting, and success metrics
  - specs/001-static-docs-site/spec.md: mark feature as complete + add "Implementation Guide: Eleventy Configuration"
  - specs/001-static-docs-site/tasks.md: mark IMPLEMENTATION COMPLETE and include full Eleventy Configuration Guide, scripts, troubleshooting, and verification steps

- docs/ (generated output)
  - Add generated site files under /docs and subfolders:
    - docs/index.html
    - docs/features/index.html
    - docs/getting-started/index.html
    - docs/examples/index.html
    - docs/api-reference/index.html
    - docs/about/index.html
  - These files reference /assets/... (runtime url filter will rewrite during production), include prism.min.js and theme references, and contain the final site content ready for GitHub Pages.

Notes / rationale:
- pathPrefix in Eleventy affects both URL generation and output layout. The commit adopts an environment-aware pathPrefix and ensures all templates use the `url` filter so assets and links work identically in dev (root) and production (GitHub Pages subdirectory).
- Data cache files written during build must be excluded from Eleventy watch to avoid infinite rebuild loops - added watchIgnores for nuget-cache.json.
- Replaced placeholder Prism assets with a real npm-based bundling approach (scripts/copy-prism.js) to supply full syntax highlighting for C# and other languages.
- Updated package scripts to run copy-prism before production builds and to set ELEVENTY_ENV via cross-env for cross-platform compatibility.
- Specs and tasks were updated with an Implementation Summary and detailed "Implementation Learnings" to aid future maintenance.

Testing / verification:
- Local dev: run `cd src && npm install && npm run copy:prism && npm run dev` ; verify http://localhost:8080 loads site with CSS and Prism highlighting.
- Production build: `npm run build` will output `../docs/WebSpark.HttpClientUtility/` containing the production-ready site; serve it locally to verify behavior before pushing to GitHub Pages.
- GitHub Pages: target /docs folder; pathPrefix ensures subdirectory URLs are correct.

This commit completes the static documentation site end-to-end: configuration, content, build tooling, syntax highlighting, NuGet integration, tests/validation scripts, and generated /docs output ready for publishing.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
chore(docs,specify): move docs to documentation and add .specify scaffolding

- Move top-level docs from /docs to /documentation and update README links
- Update WebSpark.HttpClientUtility.csproj to pack documentation files under PackagePath "documentation\"
- Remove legacy docs/* files and add corresponding files under documentation/ (CONTRIBUTING, GettingStarted, SECURITY, archive/QUICK_PUBLISH_CHECKLIST, etc.)
- Add .specify feature tooling and templates:
  - .specify/templates: spec/plan/tasks/checklist/agent-file templates
  - .specify/memory/constitution.md (initial constitution v1.0.0)
  - .specify/scripts/powershell: check-prerequisites.ps1, common.ps1, create-new-feature.ps1, setup-plan.ps1, update-agent-context.ps1
  - .github/prompts: speckit.* prompts for specify/plan/tasks/implement/checklist/clarify/constitution/etc.
- Add agent-file-template and copilot session artifacts for documentation of template changes
- Add .vscode/settings.json to recommend speckit prompts and auto-approve specify scripts
- Housekeeping: update packaging and README references; no changes to library runtime code

This change reorganizes docs and adds the Spec-Driven Development scaffolding for feature/spec/plan/task workflows.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message: Release v1.4.0 - Add .NET 8 support, simplified DI, improved docs
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message: Release v1.3.2: Fix CurlCommandSaver tests and improve test reliability
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Refactor tests and add logging improvements

Refactored `CurlCommandSaverTests` for better readability and maintainability. Added `Microsoft.Extensions.Logging` for enhanced logging. Improved configuration handling and added new test cases to verify behavior when `CsvOutputFolder` is missing. Replaced outdated test with `SaveCurlCommandAsync_WithoutConfiguration_DoesNotCreateFile`.

Updated solution file to include `Solution Items` folder with `.gitignore` and GitHub Actions workflow for CI/CD support.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message: Fix NuGet Packages signature validation in GitHub Actions
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Patch release enhancing CurlCommandSaver with:
• ✨ Batch processing (100 commands/batch)
• 📁 File rotation (10MB default)
• 🔒 Sensitive data sanitization (headers & JSON)
• 🔄 Retry logic with exponential backoff
• ⚙️ Comprehensive configuration options
The test web (WebSpark.HttpClientUtility.Web) already exists and can be used to demonstrate these new CurlCommandSaver features.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
feat: improve packaging, docs, and code quality

- Switched project SDK to `Microsoft.NET.Sdk` for proper library packaging.
- Added `.editorconfig` for consistent code style enforcement.
- Enhanced documentation with `CONTRIBUTING.md`, `SECURITY.md`, and more.
- Updated `.gitignore` to exclude coverage, build artifacts, and test results.
- Added new tests for `HttpClientConcurrentProcessor` and OpenTelemetry.
- Improved NuGet configuration with `nuget.config` and metadata updates.
- Reduced build warnings by 35% and applied automated code formatting.
- Enhanced OpenTelemetry integration with configurable exporters.
- Enabled deterministic builds and Source Link for better debugging.
- Documented future roadmap for multi-targeting and versioning automation.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

chore: expand gitignore for test artifacts

Added patterns for: auto-generated Properties folders, TestResults directory, .trx test results, and .runsettings.user files

These are test framework artifacts that should not be committed.

value.message:
chore: ignore coverage reports and build artifacts

Added patterns to .gitignore for: CoverageReport/, coverage-*/, build_output.txt, artifacts/

These are generated artifacts that should not be committed to the repository.

fix: apply code formatting and suppress test-specific warnings

Changes: Add CA2007 suppression to test project, Apply automated formatting to 111 files, Ensure EditorConfig compliance

All 251 tests passing, no functional changes. Phase 1 complete.

Updated README.md for v1.2.0 release, highlighting new features, dependency updates, and stability improvements. Removed deprecated web crawler functionality from the library and documentation. value.message:
Release v1.1.0: Remove deprecated Jaeger exporter, modernize to OTLP-only approach

- BREAKING: Removed OpenTelemetry.Exporter.Jaeger package dependency
- BREAKING: Updated AddWebSparkOpenTelemetryWithExporters API to use OTLP-only
- Updated to modern OTLP exporter (supports Jaeger, Zipkin, and other OTLP-compatible systems)
- Enhanced documentation with migration guide
- Build stability improvements and code cleanup
- All 79 tests passing
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Release v1.0.10: Major feature updates

Added Features:
- OpenTelemetry integration with comprehensive tracing support
- Streaming support for large HTTP responses (configurable threshold)
- Authentication providers (API Key, Basic Auth, Bearer Token)
- Object pooling for HttpRequestMessage and StringBuilder
- Enhanced telemetry and observability

Improvements:
- Enhanced error handling and resource management
- Better async/await patterns with ConfigureAwait(false)
- Improved memory efficiency for large responses
- Comprehensive test coverage for new features

Bug Fixes:
- Fixed HttpVersion compatibility issues
- Resolved resource disposal patterns
- Fixed nullable reference warnings

Documentation:
- Updated README.md with new features and examples
- Enhanced CHANGELOG.md with detailed v1.0.10 changes
- Added comprehensive code examples for new functionality
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Enhance JSON converters and cURL command handling

- Updated `NewtonsoftJsonStringConverterTests.cs` and `SystemJsonStringConverterTests.cs` to include necessary using directives and a `TestModel` class for JSON conversion tests.
- Introduced `CurlCommandSaverOptions` in `CurlCommandSaver.cs` for configuration management, enhancing cURL command saving with batch processing, error handling, and file rotation.
- Added `CurlCommandSaverTests.cs` to cover unit tests for the `CurlCommandSaver` class, validating various request scenarios.
- Introduced `HttpRequestResultTests.cs` to test the `HttpRequestResult<T>` class, ensuring proper handling of status codes, request duration, and error logging.
- Updated project version from `1.0.5` to `1.0.6` in `WebSpark.HttpClientUtility.csproj`.
